gurmukhi: hom jg neIbyd kY pUjw Anyk jp qp sMjm Anyk puMn dwn kY
transliteration: Hom Jag Naeebayd Kai Poojaa Anayka , Jap Tap Sanjam Anayk Pounn Daan Kai ?
translation: Performing ritualistic worships, making offerings to the gods, performing worship of many kinds, living life in penance and Strict discipline, making charity;

gurmukhi: jl Ql igr qr qIrQ Bvn BUA ihmwcl Dwrw AgR Arpn pRwn kY
transliteration: Jal Dal Gir Tar Teerad Bhavan Bhooa , Himaachal Dhaaraa Agr Arapan Praan Kai ?
translation: Roaming in deserts, water bodies mountains, places of pilgrimage and wasteland, giving up life while approaching the snow clad summits of Himalaya;

gurmukhi: rwg nwd bwd swAMgIq byd pwT bhu shj smwiD swiD koit jog iDAwn kY
transliteration: Raag Naad Baad Saaangeet Bayd Paatth Bahu , Sahaj Samaadhi Saadhi Koti Jog Dhiaan Kai ?
translation: Performing recitation of Vedas, singing in modes to the accompaniment of musical instruments, practicing obstinate exercises of Yoga, and indulging in millions of contemplations of Yogic discipline;

gurmukhi: crn srin gur isK swDsMig pir vwir fwrau ingH hT jqn kotwin kY ]255]
transliteration: Charan Sarani Gur Sikh Saadhasangi Pari , Vaari Daarau Nigrah Hatth Jatan Kotaani Kai ?255?
translation: Abstaining the senses from vices and trying other obstinate practices of Yoga, all this is sacrificed by a Guru-conscious person over the company of saintly persons and the refuge of the True Guru. All these practices are trivial and inane. (255)
